originalTitle: 'Half of my friends were killed' - the girls returning to a school caught up in war
title: Strong Hearts, Bright Futures: Twins Return to School
content:
Hello, Amazing Kids!

Hello everyone! It's your kid-friendly news reporter from Africa! Today, we have a very special story about two super brave girls. They are twins, which means they look very much alike and are best friends! Their story comes from a place where something very sad happened, but it also shows how strong and determined kids can be.

Meet Our Brave Twins!

Imagine having a best friend who is also your sister! That's exactly what our story is about. These two wonderful girls are twins. Let's call them Lami and Ami for our story, even though their real names might be different. They live in a part of Africa where sometimes there are big troubles. Lami and Ami love going to school. Just like you, they love to learn new things. They love seeing their friends and playing during break time. School is a very important place for them.

A Sad Day at School

One day, something very scary happened near their school. There were big, loud noises, like a giant thunderstorm, but much, much scarier. These loud noises were called “shelling.” It means big, noisy things were being thrown, and they made loud bangs and broke things. It was not safe. **Did you know?** Sometimes, when grown-ups are fighting in a place, they use very loud things that can make big noises and break buildings. This is called a conflict or war. It's very sad when this happens, especially near schools. Because of this scary event, some of Lami and Ami's friends were hurt, and some even died. Can you imagine how sad that must make someone feel? Losing your friends is one of the saddest things ever. Half of their friends were gone. Their hearts were very, very sad.

Why Go Back to School?

After such a sad and scary time, some people might want to stay home forever. It's normal to feel scared or sad. But Lami and Ami thought about their friends. They remembered how much fun they all had learning together. They decided something very important. They decided they *must* go back to school. They wanted to finish their studies. Why? Because they know how important learning is. They also want to honor their friends who can no longer come to school. They want to learn for them too. **Did you know?** When something very hard happens, but you decide to be strong and keep trying, that's called being “determined” or “resilient”! Lami and Ami are incredibly determined girls.

Learning Makes You Strong

Going back to school was not easy for Lami and Ami. Every day, they might remember their friends who are not there. The school might look a little different. But inside their hearts, a fire is burning bright. This fire is their wish to learn. At school, they learn to read amazing stories about animals and far-off lands. They learn to write beautiful letters and numbers. They learn about science and how the world works. Every new thing they learn makes them smarter and stronger. **Did you know?** Education, which means going to school and learning, is like a superpower! It helps you understand the world, get a good job when you grow up, and even help your community.

Making New Friends and Dreams

Even though their old friends are gone, new friends will come. Lami and Ami can meet new classmates and make new happy memories. They can play games during break time and share their lunch. School is not just for learning from books; it's also for learning to be a good friend and how to work with others. Lami and Ami have big dreams. Maybe one day, they want to be teachers themselves, so they can help other children learn. Maybe they want to be doctors and help sick people. Or maybe they want to be engineers and build strong houses that are safe. Their determination to go back to school shows us that even when life is tough, we can still choose to be brave and chase our dreams. **Did you know?** Many, many children in Africa love going to school! They walk long distances sometimes just to get to their classroom because they know how important it is to learn.

We Can All Be Brave

Lami and Ami's story reminds us that learning is a gift. It also reminds us to be kind to our friends and appreciate every day we have at school. When you go to school, you are building your future, step by step. It's a very sad thing that war and conflict can make schools unsafe. We hope that all children, everywhere in Africa and around the world, can always go to school in peace and safety. Lami and Ami are heroes. They show us that even when the world is sad, we can still choose hope, learning, and a bright future. Let's send them a big cheer! Hooray for Lami and Ami!
summary: Two brave twin sisters, Lami and Ami, returned to school to finish their studies after a scary event caused them to lose many of their classmates.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows us how important school and learning are, and how being brave and determined can help you chase your dreams, even when sad things happen.

originalTitle: Mandela's prison key, sunglasses and shirt can be sold after daughter wins court battle
title: Mandela's Special Things Can Be Sold!
content:
Hello from Africa!

Hi everyone! It's your friendly reporter, reporting live from our amazing continent, Africa! We have some big news about a very special hero named Nelson Mandela. Do you remember him? He was a super important person for South Africa and all of Africa. Today, we're talking about some of his special things, like a key, sunglasses, and a shirt.

Who Was Nelson Mandela?

Nelson Mandela was a true hero. He worked very hard to make sure everyone in South Africa was treated fairly. Long ago, things were not fair for Black people in South Africa. Nelson Mandela wanted everyone to be friends and equal. He spent many, many years helping his country become a better place for all. He even became the first Black President of South Africa! He taught us to be kind and brave and to always fight for what is right. He helped bring peace and fairness to his country after many years of struggle. Did you know? People sometimes called Nelson Mandela 'Madiba', which is a special clan name. It was a loving way to show respect for him, like calling your grandma 'Gogo' or grandpa 'Khulu'!

What Are We Talking About?

Today, we are talking about three things that belonged to this great man. They are a special key, a pair of sunglasses, and a shirt. These are not just any old key, sunglasses, or shirt. Oh no! They are very, very special because they belonged to Nelson Mandela himself. Imagine having something that belonged to your favorite superhero! That's how special these items are to many people in South Africa and around the world. They are like little treasures that tell a big story.

The Special Key

Let's talk about the key first. This key is super important because it opened the door to his prison cell. A prison is a place where people have to stay if they break rules. But Nelson Mandela was put in prison for a very long time because he was fighting for fairness for everyone. He was a brave leader who wanted peace, not trouble. This key reminds us of how long he was kept away from his family, just because he wanted everyone to be free and equal. When he finally came out of prison, it was a joyful day for everyone! People celebrated all over the country. Did you know? Nelson Mandela spent 27 long years in prison! That's almost as long as some of your parents have been alive! He never gave up hope, even when things were very difficult.

His Sunglasses and Shirt

Next are his sunglasses and a shirt. You might think, 'But sunglasses and a shirt are normal things!' And you are right! But these were *his* normal things. They show us how he lived every day, even after becoming a world leader. His sunglasses probably protected his eyes from the bright African sun as he traveled and met people. And his shirts were often colorful and bright, just like his spirit! When we see these items, we can imagine him wearing them, smiling, and teaching people about peace and kindness. Did you know? Nelson Mandela loved to wear special 'Madiba shirts' that were often bright and patterned. They became famous all over the world because he wore them so much! They showed his happy and free spirit.

Why Were They Stopped? (About Heritage)

Some grown-ups in South Africa, who we call 'the authorities', tried to stop these items from leaving the country. They said these things are part of South Africa's 'heritage'. What is heritage? Heritage means special old things that tell us important stories about our past and our country. It's like your grandparent's old photos or a special family story that makes your family unique. These items help us remember who we are and where we come from as a nation. The authorities felt that Mandela's key, sunglasses, and shirt were like treasures that should stay in South Africa. They believed these items belong to all the people of South Africa, helping everyone remember their history and their great hero. Did you know? Many countries have museums that keep special heritage items safe. This way, children like you can visit and learn about important people and events from long ago! It's like a big storybook you can walk through.

The Court Battle

So, what happened next? Nelson Mandela's daughter, who is his child, wanted to sell these items. But the authorities said 'no'! When people don't agree on something important, they can go to a special place called a 'court'. In a court, there's a special person called a 'judge'. The judge listens very carefully to both sides of the story, like a referee in a game. The judge then makes a fair decision about what should happen. It's like having a big argument, but with a very wise person to help sort it out and make a ruling.

The Decision

After listening carefully to both sides, the judge made a decision. The judge said that Nelson Mandela's daughter *can* sell the key, the sunglasses, and the shirt. This means she is now allowed to find new homes for these very special items if she wishes. Selling something means someone else buys it, and the money goes to the person who sold it. So, these items might be bought by someone who wants to keep them safe and remember Nelson Mandela. Perhaps a museum in another country will buy them to share his story with more children.

Why Are These Things Important?

Even though these items can now be sold, they will always be important. They remind us of Nelson Mandela's amazing life and his bravery. They teach us about fairness, freedom, and never giving up, no matter how hard things get. These small items hold big stories about a man who changed the world. They are like little pieces of history that we can touch and see. They help us remember our hero, Nelson Mandela, and his wish for a peaceful world where everyone is treated with respect. Did you know? Nelson Mandela won the Nobel Peace Prize! This is a very special award given to people who work hard to bring peace to the world. He truly was a champion of peace for all people!

Goodbye for now!

So there you have it, friends! A story about a special key, sunglasses, and shirt that belonged to a truly great African hero, Nelson Mandela. Whether they stay in South Africa or travel to new homes, they will always tell his amazing story. Let's remember his lessons of kindness and fairness every day and be heroes in our own communities!
summary: Nelson Mandela's daughter can now sell his prison key, sunglasses, and a shirt after winning a court case against authorities who wanted to keep the items in South Africa as national heritage.
whyMatters: These special items remind us of Nelson Mandela, a great African hero who fought for fairness and freedom for everyone. They help us remember his important story and the lessons he taught the world.

originalTitle: Somaliland president pitches business opportunities to Trump's son
title: Somaliland's President Makes Big Friends for His Country!
content:
Hello everyone! It's your friendly kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you exciting news from our amazing continent, Africa! Today, we're going on a special trip to learn about a very interesting place called Somaliland.

Meet Somaliland!

Somaliland is a place in East Africa, right next to the big blue ocean! It's part of what we call the Horn of Africa because, on a map, it looks a bit like a rhino's horn sticking out. Somaliland is a bit special. For a long time, the people of Somaliland have worked hard to be their own country. They have their own flag, their own government, and even their own money! But not all countries in the world agree that Somaliland is a fully independent country yet. It's a bit like a very grown-up family living in its own special house, but some neighbours are still getting to know them. **Did you know?** Somaliland's capital city is called Hargeisa! It's a busy and beautiful city where lots of people live and work. The leader of Somaliland is called President Muse Bihi Abdi. A President is like the main helper for a whole country, making big decisions and trying to make life better for everyone.

A Big Trip for Somaliland's President!

Guess what? President Muse Bihi Abdi went on a really important trip! He travelled very far away from Somaliland to meet some special people. Why did he go? He went to talk about Somaliland and share all the wonderful things about it. He wanted to tell the world, "Hey, come visit us, come help us grow, and let's be friends!" One of the big reasons for his trip was to talk about "business opportunities." Now, that sounds like a very grown-up word, doesn't it? But it's actually quite simple! Imagine you have a fantastic idea to build a big playground, or a new school, or a farm where lots of delicious fruits and vegetables can grow. Business opportunities are like inviting people with money and good ideas to come to Somaliland and help build these things. When new businesses come, they create jobs for people, so they can earn money to buy food, clothes, and send their children to school. It helps everyone! **Simple Explanation:** "Business opportunities" means inviting people to start new shops, factories, or projects in Somaliland. These projects can be anything from building new roads to making new products, and they help create jobs and make the community stronger.

Meeting a Special Guest: Trump's Son!

On his trip, President Muse Bihi Abdi met a special person named Donald Trump Jr. He is the son of a former president of the United States, a big country far away. Donald Trump Jr. is a grown-up who is interested in big ideas and helping businesses grow. Imagine President Abdi telling Donald Trump Jr. about Somaliland's beautiful long coastline, perfect for big ships to bring in goods or for people to enjoy the beaches. Or maybe he talked about Somaliland's strong animals, like camels and goats, which they sell to other countries. These are all part of "business opportunities"! Meeting someone like Donald Trump Jr. is important because he knows many people who might be interested in helping Somaliland grow by starting new projects there. It's like making a powerful new friend who can introduce you to other friends! **Did you know?** Somaliland has a very long coastline, which means it has beautiful beaches and important ports where ships can come and go! This is great for trade.

A Friend from Far Away: Israel!

But that's not all! The President also met with someone important from another country called Israel. Israel is a country in the Middle East, quite far from Africa. What's super special about this meeting? Israel is one of the countries that *recognises the independence* of Somaliland! What does "recognise independence" mean? Imagine you have built the most amazing, super-duper sandcastle all by yourself at the beach. You worked hard, chose all the best shells, and made it perfect. If your friend comes along and says, "Wow! That's an incredible sandcastle you built all by yourself!", that friend is *recognising* your sandcastle and that you made it independently. In the same way, Israel has said, "Yes, Somaliland! We see you as your own special country, with your own rules and your own leaders, and we respect that." This is a very big deal for Somaliland because it means more and more countries might start to recognise them too. The more friends Somaliland makes, the stronger it becomes on the world stage! **Simple Explanation:** "Independence" means being able to make your own rules and decisions, without another country telling you what to do. It's like being grown up enough to decide what you want to eat for dinner!

Why Is This Meeting So Important for Somaliland?

These meetings are super important for the children and families of Somaliland. When the President meets important people from other countries, it's like he's holding up a big sign that says, "Hello world, we are Somaliland, and we have so much to offer!" It helps Somaliland get new friends and partners around the world. These new friends can help build better schools, better roads, and new hospitals. They can help farmers grow more food and help people learn new skills. All of this helps to make life better and brighter for everyone in Somaliland. It's about building a future where every child can go to school, play safely, and dream big dreams! **Did you know?** Somaliland is also famous for its livestock! People there raise many sheep, goats, and camels, which they sell to other countries.

Fun Facts About Somaliland!

Let's learn some more fun facts about this amazing place: * **Animals:** Besides camels and goats, Somaliland also has wild animals like different types of antelopes and even some big cats, but you might need to go on a special safari to see them! * **Nature:** They have beautiful mountain ranges and wide, open plains. * **History:** Somaliland has some of the oldest cave paintings in Africa! They are called Laas Geel (say: Laas Gayl). These paintings are thousands and thousands of years old and show ancient people and animals. It's like a history book written on rocks! * **What they sell:** Besides animals, Somaliland is known for frankincense. This is a special, nice-smelling sap that comes from trees. People use it to make perfumes and incense.

What's Next for Somaliland?

These trips and meetings are just the beginning of Somaliland's journey to make more friends and build a wonderful future. We will keep watching and sharing the good news as Somaliland continues to grow and shine brightly on the map of Africa and the world. It’s an exciting time for the people of Somaliland, especially for all the children!
summary: Somaliland's President Muse Bihi Abdi met with Donald Trump Jr. and an official from Israel to talk about new business ideas and get more countries to recognise Somaliland as an independent nation, which helps bring jobs and growth to his people.
whyMatters: This is important because these meetings help Somaliland make new friends around the world, bring in exciting new businesses to create jobs for people, and show that Somaliland wants to be a strong, independent country, making life better for everyone there.

originalTitle: Indonesia resumes search for about 80 missing after landslide kills 10
title: Big Slide in Faraway Land: People Help Each Other
content:
Hello, my wonderful little friends across Africa! Your kid-friendly news reporter is here with an important story from a place far, far away called Indonesia. It’s a country made of many islands, just like little dots in the big blue ocean!

A Big Slide Happened

Imagine you are playing with your sandcastle, and suddenly, a big part of it just slides down. That’s a bit like what happened in Indonesia, but it was much, much bigger and very serious. In a town there, the ground, which had houses and trees on it, suddenly moved and slid down a hill. This is called a landslide. It happened just a few days ago, on a Saturday. The earth moved very fast, like a giant slide, carrying homes and everything with it. It was a very scary thing to happen to the people living there.

Sad News and Brave Helpers

When the ground slid, some people got hurt, and sadly, ten people did not make it. Their families and friends are very, very sad right now. It’s okay to feel sad when we hear news like this. We send them big hugs from here in Africa. But that’s not all. There are still about 80 people who are missing. This means grown-ups are working super hard to find them. They are looking everywhere, digging carefully, hoping to find everyone safe. They are very brave and kind people, working day and night to help.

What is a Landslide?

Did you know what a landslide is? It's when a big piece of land, like a hill or a mountain side, suddenly breaks off and slides down. It can be made of dirt, rocks, and mud. It’s a bit like when you spill a glass of water, and it rushes down your table, but on a giant, giant scale with soil! Sometimes, landslides happen because there has been a lot of rain. When it rains too much, the soil on the hill gets very, very wet and heavy. It becomes like mushy mud. Then, the land cannot hold itself up anymore, and *whoosh*! It slides down because of gravity, which is the same force that pulls your ball to the ground when you drop it. Did you know? Indonesia has many mountains and hills, and sometimes, it rains a lot there, which can make landslides happen.

Helping Hands Work Hard

When something big and sad like this happens, many heroes come out to help. In Indonesia, special teams of helpers are there. They are like our own brave police and firefighters, but they are specially trained for big emergencies. They use special tools, like diggers and shovels, to carefully move the earth and search for the missing people. They also have dogs with very good noses that help sniff around for people who might be trapped. It's very hard work, like digging a very big hole in your garden, but much more difficult and important. They also bring blankets, food, and water for the people who lost their homes. Imagine losing your toys and your bed! These helpers make sure everyone has what they need and a safe place to stay. They are true superstars! Did you know? Rescue workers often wear bright uniforms so they can be easily seen, especially when it's dusty or dark.

Learning About Safety

What can we learn from this? Well, it reminds us that nature can be very powerful. Sometimes, the earth moves, the wind blows strongly, or the rain falls very, very hard. It's important to always listen to your grown-ups, like your parents or teachers, especially if they tell you to stay in a safe place. If you live near a hill or a big slope, it’s good to know that sometimes heavy rain can make the ground soft. But remember, there are always grown-ups who know how to keep you safe and help others. Did you know? Scientists study landslides to help people know where they might happen and try to keep everyone safe before they do!

Sending Love and Hope

Even though this happened far away in Indonesia, it's important to remember that we are all part of one big global family. When one part of our family is hurting, we all feel a little bit sad. We send our strongest wishes and hopes to the people in Indonesia. We hope the brave helpers find everyone who is missing, and that the people who lost their homes can start to rebuild their lives and feel safe again. Kindness and helping each other are super important, always. Your kid-friendly reporter from Africa, signing off with a big smile and a warm heart for all of you!
summary: In Indonesia, a big landslide caused by heavy rain sadly took 10 lives and left about 80 people missing, but brave helpers are working hard to find everyone and help those affected.
whyMatters: This news shows us that nature can be very powerful and sometimes cause big problems, but it also shows how people are very kind and brave, working together to help others when bad things happen.

originalTitle: Mass arrests at UK protest in support of hunger-striking detainee
title: Friends Speaking Up in a Far-Off City!
content:
Hello, My Little News Stars!

Hello, amazing kids of Africa! It's your friendly news reporter here. Today, we have a story from a big city far, far away. It's in a country called the United Kingdom, and the city is called London. Even though it's far away, it's good to know what's happening around the world. It helps us understand how grown-ups try to make things fair and kind.

A Big Day in London

So, in London, something interesting happened. Many people gathered outside a big building. They were there to show that they cared about someone inside that building. These people were being very peaceful. That means they were not fighting or being mean. They were just standing and talking and holding signs. But then, something else happened. The police, who are like helpful guards, took many of these grown-ups away. This is called 'arresting' them.

What is a Protest, Anyway?

Imagine you really, really want something to change. Maybe your friend is sad, and you want to make them happy. You might tell your teacher or your mum. Well, grown-ups sometimes want big things to change in the world. When many grown-ups come together to show they want something to change, it's called a protest. They might hold signs with words on them. They might sing songs or shout in a kind way. They use their voices to make a big noise, hoping people will listen. They do it to help someone who they think needs help. They do it to make things better for everyone. Did you know? People have been protesting for many, many years! It's one way to show you care about fairness and kindness in the world.

Where is a Prison?

Now, let's talk about the big building in our story. It's called a prison. A prison is a special place where grown-ups go if they have broken important rules or laws. It's a very safe place, but it means the people inside cannot leave. They stay there to learn from their mistakes or to be kept safe from others, or for others to be safe from them. Our story is about someone who was inside a prison. The people outside wanted to help this person. Did you know? Prisons have guards, just like schools have teachers, to make sure everyone inside is safe and follows the rules.

Who is a "Detainee"?

The person the grown-ups were protesting for is called a 'detainee'. This is a big word, but it just means someone who is being held in a place like a prison or a special holding centre. Sometimes, a detainee is waiting for someone to decide what will happen to them next. They might not have broken a rule yet, but there's a question about where they should live or what they should do. The grown-ups outside the prison believed this detainee needed their help. They felt very strongly that this person should be treated kindly and fairly.

What is a Hunger Strike?

Now, this is a very special and important part of our story. The detainee inside the prison was doing something called a 'hunger strike'. Imagine you are very hungry, but you decide not to eat your food. You do this to show how serious you are about something. This person was not eating food because they wanted a big change to happen. They felt so strongly about it that they were willing to feel very weak and unwell. It's a way grown-ups sometimes use their bodies to say, "Please, please listen to me! This is so important!" It shows they are really, really determined. Did you know? Our bodies need food and water every day to be strong and healthy. That's why not eating is a very serious thing for grown-ups to do.

Why Did People Protest?

So, the people outside the prison were protesting because they wanted to help the person on the hunger strike. They wanted people in charge to listen to the detainee's message. They wanted to make sure the detainee was heard and that their situation was looked at very carefully. They wanted to show support and kindness. It was their way of saying, "We care about this person, and we want things to be fair for them." They used their voices to speak up.

What Did the Police Do?

When many people gather in one place, the police are there to make sure everyone stays safe and that everything is peaceful. In this story, the police took many of the grown-ups away. This is called 'arresting' them. Sometimes, when a protest gets too big or goes on for too long in one place, the police have to step in. They have rules they need to follow, too. Their job is to keep everyone safe and make sure the city's rules are followed, even during a protest. Did you know? Police officers are like helpful superheroes in many ways! They help people who are lost, keep roads safe, and make sure everyone follows the rules so we can all live happily together.

Speaking Up with Kindness

So, what does this story teach us, my little news stars? It shows us that grown-ups, just like kids, want to be heard when something is important to them. It shows that people care about each other, even strangers. And it shows that sometimes, people have to make a big noise to get others to listen. But remember, it's always best to speak up with kindness and peace. We can all use our voices to make the world a better, fairer, and kinder place for everyone. Keep shining!
summary: In London, UK, many peaceful protesters were arrested by police while showing support for a person inside a prison who was not eating food to make their voice heard.
whyMatters: This story helps us understand that people sometimes gather to show they care very much about someone or something, even in faraway places, and they use their voices to ask for fairness and kindness.

originalTitle: Minneapolis live news: US federal agents shoot dead nurse Alex Pretti
title: Remembering Alex, a Kind Helper
content:
Hello, hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! It’s your friendly news reporter, here from our beautiful continent, ready to share a story with you. Today, we're going to talk about a very special person named Alex, and why being kind and helping others is one of the most important things we can do. Sometimes, news can be a little bit sad, but even with sad news, we can find important lessons about love, kindness, and helping each other, just like we do in our big African family.

Meet Alex Pretti, The Kind Nurse

Our story today is about a man named Alex Pretti. Alex was a nurse. Do you know what nurses do? Nurses are like real-life superheroes! They work in hospitals and clinics, and their job is to help people when they are sick or hurt. They make sure you take your medicine, feel comfortable, and get better so you can go back to playing with your friends and learning at school. Alex loved helping people, and he was very good at his job. He had a big, kind heart and always wanted to make sure everyone was safe and healthy. Did you know? Nurses learn so much about the human body and how to take care of it! They are very clever and very caring!

When People Share Their Voices

Sometimes, in different places around the world, people gather together. They do this because they want to share their feelings about something important. It's like when you want your parents or your teacher to understand how you feel about a new rule, or if you think something is unfair. When many people gather, they might hold signs or sing songs to show everyone what they believe in. They want to make sure their voices are heard and that things are fair and good for everyone in their community. It’s important that when people gather, they do it peacefully and respectfully, like when we talk to our elders. We listen, and we share our thoughts calmly.

Alex's Helping Heart

Alex, our kind nurse, was in a place where many people had gathered to share their feelings. He wasn't there to cause any trouble. Oh no! Alex was there because he wanted to help. Just like a nurse always wants to help, Alex saw people and wanted to make sure they were okay. He was looking out for everyone, making sure no one was hurt or sad. Videos show that Alex was holding his phone in his hand. He wasn't holding anything scary or dangerous. Maybe he was going to call for help for someone, or perhaps he wanted to record something so people could understand what was happening. He was just being Alex, the helper.

A Very Sad Day

Now, this is the sad part of the story. While Alex was being so kind and trying to help others during this gathering, something very, very sad happened. He got hurt. Sadly, Alex is no longer with us. It makes us very sad when good people who help others get hurt, especially when they are only trying to do something kind. It reminds us that sometimes the world can be a bit confusing and things can go wrong. Did you know? Even when sad things happen, remembering the good deeds of people like Alex can help us feel strong and inspired to be kind ourselves!

Why Helping is So Important

Alex's story teaches us something very important. It teaches us about the power of kindness and the importance of helping others. Even if things go wrong sometimes, it doesn't mean we should stop being kind. When you help a friend who falls, or share your toys, or even just say a kind word to someone who is sad, you are being like Alex. You are making the world a better, brighter place. In Africa, we have a special word called 'Ubuntu'. It means 'I am because we are'. It’s all about how we are connected and how we should always help and care for each other. Alex lived the spirit of Ubuntu with his kind heart.

Being Safe and Strong

It's very important to always listen to your parents and other grown-ups who take care of you. They know how to keep you safe. If you ever see big gatherings or feel confused, always stay with your grown-up and ask them questions. It’s good to be curious, but it’s even better to be safe. We want all our little superheroes in Africa to stay safe and healthy so you can grow up strong and happy!

Let's Be Kind

So, my dear friends, let's remember Alex Pretti for his kindness and his big helping heart. Let's promise to be kind to each other every day. Let's help our friends, our family, and even people we don't know, just like Alex did. Every act of kindness, big or small, makes our world a more loving and peaceful place. Thank you for listening, and remember: be kind, be safe, and keep shining your bright lights!
summary: Alex Pretti, a kind nurse, was hurt while trying to help people, and we remember him for his big, kind heart and his spirit of helping others.
whyMatters: It is important to remember Alex because it teaches us how important it is to be kind, to help others, and to always speak up for what is right in a peaceful way, making the world a better place for everyone.

originalTitle: Trump threatens Canada with 100% tariffs if it 'makes a deal with China'
title: Big Countries, Big Talks!
content:
Hello, amazing children of Africa! It's your friendly news reporter here, bringing you super exciting news from around our big, wide world! Today, we're going on an adventure to learn about some very important people and countries far away. Don't worry, it's all going to be simple and fun, like a story!

Meet the Big Countries!

Imagine our world is a giant playground, and all the countries are like different teams or groups of friends. Today, we're talking about two very big countries: America and Canada. They are neighbours, just like you might live next door to your best friend! America is a huge country with many people, known for big cities and lots of different things. And right next to America is Canada, another really big country, famous for its beautiful forests, snowy winters, and delicious maple syrup!

Meet the Leaders!

Every country has a special person in charge, like the head teacher of a school, or the captain of a football team. These people are called "leaders." In America, the leader we are talking about is Mr. Trump. He helps make important decisions for his country. And in Canada, the leader is Mr. Mark Carney. He is also a very important person who guides Canada. These two leaders usually work together, because America and Canada are very good friends and neighbours.

A Little Disagreement

Now, even the best of friends can sometimes have a little disagreement, right? Maybe about what game to play, or which toy to share. Well, something similar is happening between America and Canada. America’s leader, Mr. Trump, is saying something to Canada's leader, Mr. Mark Carney. He's saying, "Hey Canada, if you make a special new friend-deal with another big country called China, then America might make things from your country more expensive for us to buy!"

What Are 'Tariffs'?

This word "tariffs" sounds big and tricky, doesn't it? But it's actually quite simple. Imagine you want to buy a yummy treat, like a sweet banana, from Canada. Usually, it costs a certain amount of money. But if America puts a "tariff" on bananas from Canada, it means they add extra money to the price. So, that banana becomes more expensive for people in America to buy. It's like adding an extra pocket money amount just because it came from a certain place. **Did you know?** "Tariff" is just a fancy word for a special tax that countries put on things they buy from other countries! It helps them control what comes in and out.

Why Are They Talking Like This?

You might be wondering, why would America want to make things from Canada more expensive? Well, countries sometimes do this to try and protect their own businesses and workers. America wants to make sure that its own factories and farms are doing well. So, if they think Canada is making a deal with China that might hurt American businesses, they try to get Canada to change its mind by saying they will add tariffs. It's like saying, "Hey, let's make sure we are all playing fair and looking out for each other first!"

Did You Know?

* **Canada** is the second-largest country in the world by land area, but it has fewer people than America! * **America** is home to many famous inventions, like the light bulb and the aeroplane! * **China** is a very, very big country far away, with the most people in the world! They make lots of toys, clothes, and other things that we use every day. * When leaders talk about "making a deal" or "trade," it usually means countries are agreeing to buy and sell things from each other in a special way.

Why Does This Matter to Us?

You might be thinking, "This is happening so far away, in America, Canada, and China! Why should I, a wonderful child in Africa, care?" That's a great question! Our world is like one big family. What happens in one part of the world can sometimes affect other parts, even if it's just a little bit. For example, if things from Canada become more expensive for America, it might mean that American businesses look for things from other countries. Or, if countries are not getting along, it can sometimes make everything a little bit more difficult for everyone. Think about it like this: if your neighbours are having a disagreement, sometimes it makes the whole street feel a bit different, doesn't it? It's always better when everyone is talking nicely and working together.

Playing Fairly in the Big World

Leaders like Mr. Trump and Mr. Mark Carney have big jobs. They want to do what they think is best for the people in their countries. Sometimes, they have different ideas about what "best" means, especially when it comes to playing with other countries like China. It's important for them to talk and try to understand each other, just like when you try to sort out a disagreement with a friend. **Did you know?** Talking and discussing problems peacefully is called "diplomacy"! It's like having a really good, calm chat to find solutions.

What Happens Next?

When there's a disagreement like this, the leaders usually talk, talk, talk! They send messages, they have meetings, and they try to find a way to make everyone happy, or at least to find a solution that works for most people. The goal is always to keep the friendship strong and to make sure that countries can keep buying and selling things from each other without too many problems. It’s like when you and your friend have a small argument – you talk it out and usually find a way to play nicely again!

Our World is Connected!

So, even though this news comes from very far away, it reminds us that all countries are connected. We buy things from different countries, and we sell things to different countries. This is called "global trade," and it helps all of us get the things we need and want. When leaders talk about tariffs and deals, they are talking about how to make this global trade work fairly for everyone. It's a big, beautiful world out there, full of interesting things happening. And by learning about them, you, amazing children, become even smarter and more aware of the wonderful planet we share! Keep listening, keep learning, and keep asking questions! Goodbye for now!
summary: America's leader, Mr. Trump, is telling Canada's leader, Mr. Mark Carney, that if Canada makes a special agreement with China, America will make things from Canada more expensive.
whyMatters: This is important because when big countries disagree, it can affect how countries buy and sell things from each other, which can sometimes change prices for things we use, and it reminds us that all countries are connected like one big family.

originalTitle: Trump says UK soldiers in Afghanistan 'among greatest of all warriors'
title: Brave UK Soldiers Get a Big Shout-Out!
content:
Hello, Super Friends!

Hi everyone! It's your friendly news reporter for Africa here! I have some really exciting news to share with you today. It's about brave people who help keep the world safe. We're going to talk about a very important leader and some very brave soldiers. Are you ready for an adventure in news? Let's go! I hope you're all ready to learn something new and amazing. This story comes from far, far away, but it reminds us that heroes are everywhere!

Who is Mr. Trump?

First, let's talk about a very important person. His name is Mr. Trump. He used to be the President of a very big country called the United States of America. That's a country far across the ocean! Being a President is like being the head teacher of a whole country. A President helps make big decisions and looks after all the people in their country. They have a very important job, like making sure everyone is safe and happy. Did you know? The United States of America has many, many states, like many different rooms in a very big house!

Meet the UK Soldiers!

Now, let's meet some super special people: soldiers from the UK. The UK stands for the United Kingdom. It's another country, like a big island in the ocean. Soldiers are very brave men and women who wear special uniforms. Their job is to protect people and help keep everyone safe, sometimes even in other countries. They train very hard to be strong and smart. They are like real-life superheroes, but instead of capes, they wear helmets and carry important equipment to help others. Did you know? Soldiers also help people when there are big floods or other natural problems, not just in times of fighting!

What Happened in Afghanistan?

Our story takes us to a country called Afghanistan. It's a country far away, across many mountains and deserts. Sometimes, in some parts of the world, people have big disagreements or problems. When that happens, it can be called a "conflict." It's a time when things are not peaceful. Soldiers from different countries sometimes go to places like Afghanistan to help bring peace back and keep people safe. They try to help everyone live happily again. Did you know? Afghanistan is famous for its beautiful mountains and very old history!

A Special Message from Mr. Trump

So, what did Mr. Trump say? Well, first, he talked about soldiers from different countries who were helping in Afghanistan. He said that some of them might not have been in the very hardest and most dangerous places. But then, Mr. Trump said something else. He especially praised the soldiers from the UK. To "praise" someone means to say very, very nice things about them. He said something very special about them! Did you know? Leaders like presidents often talk about important things on television or in big meetings!

What Does "Greatest Warriors" Mean?

Mr. Trump said that the UK soldiers in Afghanistan were "among the greatest of all warriors." Wow, that's a big compliment! Let's break it down. A "warrior" is someone who is very brave and strong, and who fights to protect others. When he said "greatest," he meant the very, very best! He was saying that these UK soldiers were incredibly brave, strong, and did an amazing job helping in Afghanistan. It means he thought they were super, super heroes! Did you know? Many ancient stories tell us about brave warriors who protected their villages and kingdoms!

Friends Helping Friends (Allied Forces)

When soldiers from different countries work together, like the UK soldiers and others, they are called "allied forces." Think of it like a team of friends! If you and your friends work together to build a big sandcastle, you are allied friends, right? These allied forces work together to solve big problems and help people in places like Afghanistan. They share ideas and help each other stay safe. Working together makes them stronger! Did you know? When countries work together, it's called an "alliance," and it helps make the world a more peaceful place!

Why Was This Important?

This news is important for a few reasons. First, it shows us how important it is to say "thank you" to people who are brave and help others, even if they are far away. It also shows that sometimes, important people might say one thing, and then later say something else or add more details. But the main thing is that it reminds us to appreciate the bravery of soldiers. They work hard to keep many people safe, and that's a truly amazing thing. Did you know? Saying "thank you" can make someone feel very happy and proud of their hard work!

Let's Remember Our Heroes!

So, my super friends, today we learned about Mr. Trump, brave UK soldiers, and a place called Afghanistan. We learned that soldiers are very courageous and help people in big ways. It's good to remember that heroes are all around us, in big uniforms and even in our own homes, helping others. Let's always appreciate those who work hard to make the world a better, safer place for everyone. Thank you for listening to our news today! See you next time for more amazing stories!
summary: Mr. Trump, an important leader, praised brave soldiers from the UK for being excellent helpers in a faraway country called Afghanistan.
whyMatters: This news is important because it shows us that brave people from different countries work together to help keep peace, and it's good to say thank you to them for their courage.

originalTitle: Peace talks on Russia-Ukraine war end as fighting rages
title: Big Grown-Up Chats About Peace!
content:
Hello, Friends!

Hello, my amazing friends all across Africa! Your friendly news reporter is here. Today, we're going to talk about something important happening very, very far away. It's about two countries that are having a big disagreement. But don't worry, lots of grown-ups are trying very hard to make everything okay again. We're going to learn about "peace talks"!

What's Happening Far Away?

Imagine you and your friend are playing. Sometimes, you might have a little argument, right? Maybe about a toy or who goes first. Well, sometimes, countries have very, very big arguments. This is happening between two countries called Russia and Ukraine. They are far away from us, in a different part of the world. These two countries have been having a difficult time. There has been fighting in Ukraine. When there is fighting, it means people are not safe, and many things can get broken. It makes people very sad, and sometimes families have to leave their homes to be safe. It’s a very serious situation. **Did you know?** Ukraine is a country known for growing a lot of wheat! Wheat is what we use to make bread, noodles, and many other yummy foods!

Two Countries, One Big Problem

Russia and Ukraine are like neighbours, but they are very big neighbours! For a long time, things were okay between them. But then, they started to disagree. These disagreements grew very big, and sadly, they led to fighting. When there is fighting, it's called a war. Wars are never good. They hurt people, break things, and make everyone worried. Children can't go to school easily, and grown-ups can't go to work. It's a very challenging time for everyone in Ukraine. **Did you know?** A "country" is like a very big family living in one special place, with its own rules and leaders! Each country has its own flag, too!

What Are "Peace Talks"?

Now, here's the good news! Even when things are very difficult, grown-ups always try to find ways to make peace. This is where "peace talks" come in. Imagine if you and your friend had an argument. What would your teacher or parent tell you to do? They would tell you to talk about it, right? To listen to each other and try to find a way to be friends again. Peace talks are just like that, but for countries! It's when important people from different countries sit down together. They don't fight with words; they talk. They listen to each other's problems and try to find solutions. Their main goal is to stop the fighting and make sure everyone can live safely again. They want peace! These talks are very important because talking is always better than fighting. It's how grown-ups try to solve big problems without anyone getting hurt anymore. They want to draw a line under the past and start fresh. **Did you know?** The word "peace" means a time when there is no war or fighting, and everyone is calm and happy! It's a wonderful feeling!

Trying to Make Things Better!

So, remember those two countries, Russia and Ukraine? Well, important people from other countries are also helping. Recently, some grown-ups from these countries, and from other countries too, sat down together. They had "talks" about the fighting between Russia and Ukraine. These were special talks because they were trying to help them find peace. This was the first time they all sat down like this to talk about it. They talked for a while. Did they solve everything right away? No, not yet. Imagine if your argument was very big, it might take more than one talk to fix it, right? It's the same for countries. The news says that they didn't find all the answers in this first meeting. But here’s the hopeful part: they all agreed to meet again! This means they are not giving up. They are going to keep talking next month. This is very good news because it shows they all still want to try and make peace happen. They know it’s important to keep trying. **Did you know?** When people have "talks" about important things, it's sometimes called "negotiating." It means finding a way for everyone to agree!

Why Is Peace Important for Everyone?

You might be thinking, "This is happening far away, why is it important for me?" That's a great question! When there is fighting anywhere in the world, it can sometimes affect everyone. Think about it like this: if one part of a big, beautiful garden is not healthy, sometimes it can make other parts a little sad too. When there is peace, children can go to school, families can stay together, and everyone can feel safe. People can grow food, build houses, and just live happy lives. Peace means smiles, laughter, and a bright future. But when there is fighting, it causes many problems. People lose their homes, food becomes harder to find, and it just makes everyone sad and scared. That's why grown-ups everywhere are trying hard to bring peace back to Ukraine. They want everyone to be safe and happy. **Did you know?** When people have to leave their homes because of fighting, they are sometimes called "refugees." It's very brave of them to find new safe places.

How Does This Affect Us in Africa?

Now, let's talk about us! You might be wondering how a faraway disagreement can touch us here in Africa. Well, remember how I said Ukraine grows a lot of wheat? And sunflower oil too? These are important foods that many countries, including some in Africa, buy from Ukraine. When there is fighting, it's harder for farmers to grow wheat and for trucks and ships to deliver it. This means there might be less wheat available for everyone. When there is less of something, it sometimes costs more money to buy. So, the bread you eat, or the cooking oil your family uses, might become a little more expensive. This can make things a bit difficult for families. Also, the disagreement can sometimes make the cost of things like fuel (what cars and buses use) go up too. So, even though we are far away, these things can still affect our daily lives. That's another big reason why peace is so important, not just for Russia and Ukraine, but for everyone around the world. **Did you know?** Africa is a huge continent with many different countries, languages, and amazing cultures! We are all connected in the big world!

Hope for Tomorrow!

So, even though the grown-ups didn't find all the answers in their first talk, they are going to try again. They are hopeful! They know how important it is to keep talking and to keep looking for a way to stop the fighting. This tells us something very important: even when things are tough, we should never stop trying to find solutions and to make peace. Just like in your games, if you and your friend have an argument, talking about it and trying again is the best way to become friends again. Let's all hope that the next talks bring even more good news and that peace will come soon to Ukraine. We wish them lots of luck in their very important work! Thank you for listening, my wonderful friends. See you next time!
summary: Important grown-ups met to talk about peace between Russia and Ukraine, but didn't find all the answers yet, so they agreed to talk again next month to try and stop the fighting.
whyMatters: This is important because when countries fight, it makes many people sad and scared, and it can even make food and fuel more expensive for everyone, even here in Africa. Peace talks try to make everyone safe and happy again.

originalTitle: Adli's stoppage-time winner ends Liverpool unbeaten run in thriller
title: Wow! A Super Exciting Football Game!
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends all across Africa! It's your friendly news reporter, always ready to share exciting stories with you. Today, we have a super fun story about a football game that made everyone cheer very loudly! You know how much we love football, right? It's a game where two teams try to kick a ball into a special net called a goal. And boy, did this game have goals and lots of excitement!

A Big Football Game!

This story is about two big football teams. One team is called Liverpool, and the other team is called Bournemouth. They played a game, and guess what? Bournemouth won! It was a very, very close game, and it was exciting right until the last kick!

Meet Liverpool – The Strong Team!

Now, let me tell you about Liverpool. They are a very famous football team, and they are super good! Before this game, Liverpool had played 13 games, and they hadn't lost even one! That's like going to school for 13 days and getting all your sums right every single day. We call this an "unbeaten run." It means they were very, very hard to beat. Did you know? Liverpool wears red shirts when they play football!

Meet Bournemouth – The Brave Team!

Then there's the other team, Bournemouth. Maybe you haven't heard of them as much as Liverpool. But in football, every team tries their best! Bournemouth came to play, and they were very brave. They wanted to win, even against the strong Liverpool team. Did you know? Bournemouth's team colours are usually red and black stripes!

What is a Football Match?

Let's talk a little about football, or soccer, as some people call it! Two teams play against each other. Each team has 11 players on the field. Their main job is to kick the round ball into the other team's goal. When they score a goal, everyone cheers! The team with more goals at the end of the game wins. Did you know? The football game usually lasts for 90 minutes, but it's split into two halves of 45 minutes!

Inside the Vitality Stadium!

This exciting game happened at a big place called the Vitality Stadium. A stadium is like a giant open-air hall with lots of seats where many, many people can come to watch the game. Imagine thousands of people all together, watching the game and cheering! It must have been so loud and fun. Did you know? Some stadiums are so big, they can hold more people than live in a small town!

The Exciting Game Begins!

The game started, and both teams played so well! They kicked the ball, they ran fast, and they tried their best to score. Liverpool tried to get a goal, and Bournemouth tried to get a goal. The players worked very hard, running all over the green grass field.

The Big Moment – A Goal!

Then, something super exciting happened! A player from Bournemouth, a clever boy named Amine Adli, got the ball. He ran with it, past other players, and then... *WHOOSH!* He kicked the ball with his foot, and it flew right into the goal! Everyone from Bournemouth was so, so happy! They jumped and hugged each other.

What is Stoppage Time?

Now, here's a tricky but fun part of football. Sometimes, the referee (that's the person who makes sure everyone follows the rules) adds a little extra time at the end of the game. Why? Because sometimes the game stops for a little while, like when a player gets hurt or when they change players. This extra time is called "stoppage time" or "injury time." It means the game goes on for just a little bit longer than the normal 90 minutes. Did you know? The referee uses a whistle to stop and start the game!

Amine Adli's Amazing Goal!

So, Amine Adli's wonderful goal happened during this "stoppage time"! It was right at the very, very end of the game. Imagine everyone watching, thinking the game might end in a draw (which means no one wins). But then, Amine Adli scored! It was like magic! The whole stadium cheered so loudly, especially the Bournemouth fans.

Happy Faces and Brave Hearts!

When the game ended, the Bournemouth players and their fans were so happy! They had won against a very strong team. And Liverpool? Well, they might have been a little sad because their "unbeaten run" had stopped. But that's okay! In sports, sometimes you win, and sometimes you don't. The most important thing is to play fair and have fun.

Why This Game Was So Special!

This game was special because it was a real "thriller." That means it was exciting from the start until the very last second. No one knew who would win until Amine Adli kicked that amazing goal. It showed everyone that even big, strong teams can be surprised by brave and hard-working teams.

The End of a Run!

So, Liverpool's amazing streak of not losing any games – their 13-game unbeaten run – came to an end. Bournemouth played a super game and showed everyone that they are a strong team too. It was a day to remember for football fans!

Goodbye for Now!

Wasn't that an exciting story? Remember, football is all about trying your best, working as a team, and having lots of fun. Until next time, my friends, keep smiling and stay curious! Goodbye!
summary: Bournemouth won a super exciting football game against the strong Liverpool team with a goal right at the very end, stopping Liverpool's long streak of not losing any games.
whyMatters: This game was important because a team called Bournemouth, who many thought would not win, beat a very famous and strong team called Liverpool, ending Liverpool's amazing record of not losing 13 games in a row. It shows that in sports, anything can happen, and every team has a chance to win if they try hard.
